This was all a lie.
This game was horrible.

Logged into game. Menu screen was laggy.
Tried joining official server. Couldn't join.
Went on singleplayer. Picked sniper. Sniper scope looks as big as a T when I was in pre-school.
Gun sounds make your ears bleed. Call emergency if you intend to play this game.
Only option is graphics. Graphics on ultra were horrible anyways.
Death animation is amazing.
Strike gamemode is exactly like CS:GO. Same map.. Same playstyle. Even the buymenu.

4$ Piece of crap. Send this to your friends as a joke. I'm sure they'll give you a love punch to the nose.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What is Nuclear Shot? Ugh...

Okay, so, this is a FPS game with poor Minecraft-ish graphics. It has ridiculously simple Mode Selection screen, where you can only see Strike" and "Battle" buttons with no background
date: no theme song or any other detail whatsoever. Don't expect a title screen
recommended: because after the "Made with Unity" animation
hoursPlayed: it immediately takes you to choose modes
voteText: then you get to the menu. The only options you see in the Options menu is just graphics and sensitivity
votesHelpful: it also gives you opportunity to change your screen resolution.\n\nWhen it comes to gameplay... dear lord
votesTotal: the Battle Mode bears a strong resemblance to Battlefield 4 while the Strike Mode is literally a shameless copy of Counter-Strike: Global Offensive; same gameplay
column16: etc. I guess we're gonna expect some copyright infringement right there.\n\nYou can play on Singleplayer (and apparently the AI isn't very good on this one)
column17: but you can't play on Multiplayer; the servers are always offline. I tried to connect to official servers and via IP a bunch of times and all I got is just "Connection Failed". Then I've hosted some servers on both gamemodes
column19:
players are never coming on.

Now let's talk about the Gamemodes that we have:

In the Strike Mode
column20: you instantly get to buy weapons in the Purchase Menu (it stays up until you leave your spawn area
column21: and will appear again when you come back)
column22: then the round starts as the Red Team (Terrorists
column23: apparently) rushes to the Bomb Site and attempts to destroy it while the Blue Team (Counter-Terrorists) tries to stop them and defuse the planted C4. Strangely
column24: you can only play Bomb Defuse at the de_dust-like map
column25: but there isn't Hostage Rescue at the moment. But hey
column26: you can see players' names through the walls! Hooray for free wallhacks!... Yeah
column28: let's see the weapons.\nWhat do we have here? We've got an AK-47 (with the Vulcan Skin)
column33: and all of them are borrowed from CS:GO as well. But why does the AWP look so ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing weak?! It's not killing players in one shot and doesn't even have a bass-boosted eargasm firing sound unlike the actual AWP from Counter-Strike series.\nLet's take a look at the playermodels: everyone plays as the exact same young commando guy with different colors for two teams
column34: but it doesn't look anything like the policemen or the famous crime-based faction members like we usually had back in Counter-Strike games. At all.\nOh
column35: what is this? We can soonly have access to the the Inventory? I wonder what could it be?\n\nIn the Battle Mode
column36: you can choose three classes - Assault
column39: but you can drop 5 medkits as a Sniper (this must be something new
column40: isn't it?). Then the teams spawn in their bases and attempt to capture a flag and defend it from enemies.\nYou also have a set of driveable vehicles - Tank
column42: Jet Plane and a Helicopter. Humvee is fine
column43: but I don't know if you can shoot through that turret. The tank is somewhat fine
column44: except the projectiles and firing sound are acting weird; the firing sound doesn't sound like a cannon at all as it rather sounds like a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• rifle
column45: and the explosions don't even make a sound! Oh
column46: I might've forgot about one thing: nothing makes sounds at all
column47: except for guns. As for the jet
column49: it sure has some wacky controls and physics. Now don't get me started on that helicopter
column50: it's absolutely uncontrollable. I can only fire rockets from it but I can't go up in air. THIS IS ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•T!\nAnd again
column51: you can only play at one map and that's it. No train stations
column53: no snowy mountains from Final Stand
column55: nothing. It's only a big grassy field with a herd of static gas tanks and houses. How's that feel
column57: and I also noticed the yet another pistol when I played as a Sniper
column58: and it's detailed as an AK-47. Must be P228
column60: this game is a godawful piece of soap (you Russians will know what I mean) and a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• rip-off of CS:GO
column61: Battlefield and Ace of Spades that should've never deserved a Greenlight support and should've rather been released as an Android/iOS version... uh-oh. I'm actually sorry about this

column63: so the half of my review may not be truthful. Still

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is just bad.
This costed me money.
Remember kids Steam Refunds.

-The Hud looks like it was made with MS Paint in 5 minutes.
-The strike gamemode is a poor attempt at remaking Counter-Strike.
-The map is straight up just dust2. (The map is boring as hell too.)
-Buy menu is completely ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ed, you shoot your gun when trying to click on the transparent buy menu.
You also can't exit the menu, you have to walk out of spawn.
-You can't exit the game normally, you have to alt-f4.
-Guns have less recoil than Call of Duty.
-Also why is the Sniper icon an icon a Medic should be having.

In conclusion this is another one of those Minecraft copy and pasted games with guns, except they managed to put in several thousand times less effort.
A ton of Roblox games are higher quality than this.

And this is supposed to cost 4 dollars.

Another example of quality control on steam.

It starts off with two buttons. Strike and Battle. I had chosen battle, since I thought it would get new players into the game and used to the controls. And that it did.

I got into a server and I had chosen the engineer class. Instanly, I was almost blinded by the mesmerising graphics. What a brilliant job
date: dev!" I'd said to myself. I ran around shooting people until I died. I thought it was all over

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nNuclear Shot is the pinnacle of gaming, there are responsive controls, dawg graphics and a good sex scene in the story. You play as fabio enchilada a gay rattle snake out for revenge ever since a sausage cake murdered his pet zebra. As you go through 17 worlds you end up in the hub world, the best part is when you get to ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• scarlet johanson while riding probably the best asiimov skin to date. ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• CS:GO, ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• HL2, and ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• GTA V this game is better than the rest. There is a great story, great vehicles and also plenty of action. 6/5 its a mastapeece of gaming, buy it now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Nuclear Shot is the final word in competitive FPS.

Drawing elements from games such as Counter Strike and Battlefield, Nuclear Shot combines this with a Minecraft aesthetic.

The game is outright one word; intense.

The sound designs on the guns place the player onto the battlefield, and multiple gamemodes give you and your friends an all around enjoyable experience.
